result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Sand Ellison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 1 in 21CF743.

records.addlTxt: From DE on 5/31 stating he was recently released from jail, his paycks were lost, & he can't make pymt til Mon. Ret'd call to DE today & advised him his pymt was due on 5/15 & he should've been issued a WA on 5/27. DE to submit a req for an ext or make pymt by 4 pm today. Includes 19CT99, 21CF743, 22CF43. jaf

01:39 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: Jens Hubert Loberg, DF:  Robert Sand Ellison appeared. INCLUDES 21CF743 (PLEAS) and 22CF43 (SEH). 21CF743: ADA Ellenwood recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - OWI (4th) as charged in 21CF743. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - OWI (4th) in 21CF743. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2 in 21CF743. PSI completed on 22CF43. Sentencing arguments on both cases. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 2:08 PM. kma

Court orders:
21CF743
Ct 1 - OWI (4th)

- Absolute Sobriety
- Complete mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment

22CF43
Ct 1 - Bail Jumping - Felony
S/W 3 years probation with conditions:
- 180 total days conditional jail; 60 days to be served immediately, 120 days STAYED; concurrent to Ct 1 in 21CF743
- Succesfully complete St. Croix County treatment court
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Random testing by Agent
- Absolute Sobriety
- Complete mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through Clerk of Court


Defendant remanded into custody.
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved for balance.

Sentencing hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert Sand Ellison
Current: 414 Rounds Ave, c/o Onyx House, New Richmond, WI 54017   (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: 1209 Spruce Ct, #A, New Richmond, WI 54017
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:37 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY:  Jens Hubert Loberg, DF: Robert Sand Ellison appeared. INCLUDES 21CF743, 21TR3255, 21TR3256, 21TR3257, 21TR3258 and 22CF43 (INIT). ADA Brekken recites agreement. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - OWI (4th) WITH enhancers in 21CF743 and Ct 1 - Bail Jumping - Felony in 22CF43. Court notes previous waiver of prelim in 21CF743. 22CF43 (INIT and WOPH): NG. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. State to file information which will mirror complaint on 22CF43. Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Atty. Loberg states that he is public defender appointed on 21CF743 but has not been appointed on 22CF43. DE agrees to have Atty. Loberg represent him on 22CF43; Atty. Loberg accepts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - OWI (4th) in 21CF743 and Ct 1 - Bail Jumping - Felony in 22CF43. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2 in 21CF743 and 21TR3255, 21TR3256, 21TR3257 and 21TR3258 in their entirety. Sentencing arguments. Court orders PSI; due 2 weeks prior to sentencing hearing. Court sets sentencing hearing. Bond continues. Defendant remanded into custody, authorized for Huber after 48 hours served pending sentencing hearing. DE updates address. Adjourned: 10:17 AM. 10:23 AM - Case recalled. Appearances as previously noted. Court notes issues regarding DE reporting to jail today without completing sentencing today and authorization for EHM. Court withholds acceptance of previous plea and sets aside entry of judgment of conviction on 21CF743; bond continued. Court orders PSI on 22CF43 only. Court will complete plea process regarding 21CF743 at next hearing; bond continued. Adjourned. kma  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by State. Request to schedule on 02/01/22 at 0930 AM . arc
